casebody.data:
Watson v. Godwin. (Supreme Court, General Term, First Department. December 31, 1891.) Appeal from circuit court, New York county. Action by Jessie Watson against Parke Godwin. On trial before a jury, they found a verdict for plaintiff. A motion by defendant for a new trial was denied, and judgment was entered for plaintiff. Defendant appeals from the judgment and the order denying his motion for a new trial. Reversed.

Argued before Van Brunt, P. J., and Daniels and Barrett, JJ.

Nelson Smith, {L. C. Waehner, of counsel,) for appellant. Wm. W. Badger, for respondent. Barrett, J.

For the reasons stated in the opinion handed down herewith, in the case of Ruth Torbett v. Same Defendant, (16 N. Y. Supp. 46,) the judgment and order appealed from should be reversed, and a new trial ordered, with costs to the appellant to abide the event. All concur.
